intro: Cherleria dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous cherleria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its branching structure and distinctive leaf arrangement. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and a branching stem, which contribute to its unique appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
